radiographic_examinations.findings: Diffuse osteoporosis and calcifications of the tendons at the knees, elbows, and ankles, with further progression of degenerative changes in the knees.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Further progression of degenerative changes in the knees.

radiographic_examinations.findings: No evidence of hypertension or cardiomegaly.

Osteopenia of the hands, shoulder joints, and pelvic bones; hyperostosis frontalis; right knee showed osteopenia consistent with status post removal of infected prosthesis; both knees showed superior displacement of the patella and associated calcifications; left knee showed reduction in joint space with loss of articular cartilage and erosion of the femoral medial condyle and proximal tibia, leading to varus deformity.
